Context.Description: The Second Nagorno-Karabakh War erupted in September 2020 between the armed forces of Azerbaijan and the self-proclaimed Republic of Artsakh, backed by Armenia. The war was marked by the extensive use of drones and modern warfare technology. It resulted in significant territorial gains for Azerbaijan, leading to a ceasefire agreement in November 2020 facilitated by Russia. The war had profound humanitarian implications, including civilian casualties, ethnic cleansing allegations, and a large number of displaced people.

Second_Nagorno_Karabakh_War.Location: Nagorno-Karabakh and surrounding territories, Armenia–Azerbaijan border

Specific_Outcomes: Ethnic cleansing of Armenian population in parts conquered by Azerbaijan
Territorial_Changes: Azerbaijan regains control of several areas
Post-ceasefire: Armenia cedes occupied territories surrounding Nagorno-Karabakh to Azerbaijan
Unblocking of economic and transport connections in the region

Strength.Azerbaijan: 14,272+ servicemen, 2,580+ Syrian fighters, Turkey: 350 officers, Grey Wolves: 200, Chechen volunteers: 100–300
Strength.Armenia: Unknown regular military, T-72 tanks, various types of armoured vehicles, Scud-B and OTR-21 Tochka tactical ballistic missiles

Armenia.Military: 3,825 servicemen killed, ~11,000 wounded and sick, 60+ captured

International.Russian: 1 Mi-24 shot down, 2 crew members killed, 1 injured
International.Others: 2 French and 3 Russian journalists injured, 1 Iranian civilian injured
